and sizes (including Ishango scans and CText mirrors), see ../SOURCES_INDEX.md.

================================================================================
SCIENCE MUSEUM OFFICIAL TECHNICAL DOCUMENTATION (3 files, ~54 MB)
================================================================================

[001] 01_ScienceMuseum_DE2_Technical_Description.pdf
  Size: ~18.7 MB
  Source: https://www.sciencemuseum.org.uk/sites/default/files/2023-09/
          DE2_Technical_Description.pdf
  Description: Complete technical specification of Difference Engine No. 2
               Including all 8,000+ mechanical parts, assembly procedures,
               original design principles from Babbage's drawings.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[002] 02_ScienceMuseum_DE2_Technical_Online.pdf
  Size: ~17.8 MB
  Source: https://www.sciencemuseum.org.uk/sites/default/files/2023-08/
          DE2_TD_Online_Vsn_March_2020_SEC1_0.pdf
  Description: Alternative format version of technical description
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[003] 03_ScienceMuseum_DE2_User_Manual.pdf
  Size: ~17.9 MB
  Source: https://www.sciencemuseum.org.uk/sites/default/files/2023-08/
          User_Manual_PDF_Vsn_1.1_Final_SEC1.pdf
  Description: Operating manual for the reconstructed machine (1985-2002)
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

================================================================================
CORE ACADEMIC PAPERS (2 files, ~2.9 MB)
================================================================================

[004] 04_Bromley_Analytical_Engine_1838.pdf
  Size: ~1.85 MB
  Author: Allan G. Bromley (renowned Babbage scholar)
  Source: https://anthony-zhang.me/blog/rod-logic/an-engine.pdf
  Description: Detailed analysis of Babbage's 1838 Analytical Engine design,
               mechanical principles, carry mechanisms, number storage.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[005] 05_Menabrea_Sketch_Analytical_Engine_1843.pdf
  Size: ~1.12 MB
  Author: Luigi Federico Menabrea (translated with notes by Ada Lovelace)
  Source: https://johnrhudson.me.uk/computing/Menabrea_Sketch.pdf
  Description: First published description of the Analytical Engine (1843).
               Includes Ada's seven notes (3x original text length).
               Contains first computer program (Bernoulli numbers).
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[006] 06_Redeeming_Charles_Babbage_Mechanical_Computer.pdf
  Size: ~404 KB
  Source: https://www.softouch.on.ca/kba/data/Babbage.pdf
  Description: Historical rehabilitation and feasibility analysis of Babbage's
               mechanical computing concepts.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

================================================================================
ADA LOVELACE PAPERS & ANALYSIS (4 files, ~13.5 MB)
================================================================================

[007] 07_Robins_Ada_and_First_Computer.pdf
  Size: ~541 KB
  Author: Jeffrey Robins (Lovelace scholar)
  Source: https://www.cs.virginia.edu/~robins/Ada_and_the_First_Computer.pdf
  Description: Comprehensive analysis of Ada's mathematical contributions,
               significance of her "Notes", first algorithm interpretation.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[008] 08_Ada_Lovelace_Logic_Analytical_Engine.pdf
  Size: ~12.2 MB
  Author: M.A.P. Dwyer (Bristol University)
  Source: https://people.maths.bris.ac.uk/~mapdw/ada-lovelace-talk.pdf
  Description: Deep analysis of Ada's logical framework, symbolic reasoning,
               philosophical foundations of programming.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[009] 09_Stonybrook_Ada_Lovelace_Notes.pdf
  Size: ~431 KB
  Author: Educational compilation (Stony Brook University)
  Source: https://iacs.stonybrook.edu/challenge/_images/LOVELACE.pdf
  Description: Educational materials on Ada's Notes, code examples,
               Bernoulli algorithm explained, notation translation.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[010] 10_Rod_Smith_Ada_Lovelace_Notes.pdf
  Size: ~131 KB
  Author: Rod Smith (independent scholar)
  Source: https://rodsmith.nz/wp-content/uploads/
          Lovelace_1847_TAP-Ada-Lovelace-Notes.pdf
  Description: Alternative scholarly interpretation of Ada's Notes,
               notation clarification, historical document analysis.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

================================================================================
DORON SWADE & RECONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTATION (1 file, ~1.5 MB)
================================================================================

[013] 13_DoronSwade_Construction_Difference_Engine.pdf
  Size: ~1.516 MB
  Author: Doron Swade (Science Museum curator)
  Source: https://ed-thelen.org/bab/DoronSwadeIEEE.pdf
  Description: IEEE paper on 17-year reconstruction project (1985-2002).
               Methodology, problem-solving, materials adaptation, testing.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

================================================================================
UNIVERSITY LECTURE MATERIALS & COURSES (2 files, ~3.9 MB)
================================================================================

[014] 14_Stanford_The_Analytical_Engine.pdf
  Size: ~3.9 MB
  Institution: Stanford University (CS208e course)
  Source: https://web.stanford.edu/class/cs208e/lectures/02-analytical-engine/
          02-TheAnalyticalEngine.pdf
  Description: Pedagogical overview of the Analytical Engine,
               functional descriptions, historical context in computing.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[015] 15_Plymouth_Analytical_Engine_Original_Computer.pdf
  Size: N/A (server issue)
  Institution: Plymouth University (CSDI1400 course)
  Source: https://turing.plymouth.edu/~zshen/Webfiles/notes/
          CSDI1400/note2.pdf
  Description: Course material on Analytical Engine as original computer
  Status: ⚠ Download attempted (server response issue)

================================================================================
HISTORICAL & PHILOSOPHICAL ANALYSIS (1 file, ~51 KB)
================================================================================

[016] 16_York_Babbage_Mechanical_Model_Mind.pdf
  Size: ~51 KB
  Author: Christopher Strachey / York University scholars
  Source: https://www.yorku.ca/christo/papers/babbage-HoP.pdf
  Description: Philosophical examination of Babbage's claims about mechanical
               cognition, early AI theory, critique and analysis.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

[017] 17_Montana_Binary_Number_System_Development.pdf
  Size: ~826 KB
  Institution: University of Montana
  Source: https://scholarworks.umt.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?
          article=1315&context=tme
  Description: Historical development of binary arithmetic from Leibniz onwards,
               connection to mechanical computing, pedagogical implications.
  Status: ✓ Downloaded

ASSOCIATED ONLINE RESOURCES (Not Downloaded - Reference URLs)
================================================================================

FULL TEXT SOURCES (Free, No Login Required):

Ada Lovelace Notes - Classics in the History of Psychology
  URL: https://psychclassics.yorku.ca/Lovelace/lovelace.htm
  Format: HTML, fully searchable

Menabrea's Original 1842 Text
  URL: https://psychclassics.yorku.ca/Lovelace/menabrea.htm
  Format: HTML with scholarly apparatus

Project Gutenberg - Sketch of the Analytical Engine
  URL: https://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/75107
  Format: EPUB, Kindle, HTML, plain text
  Features: Free, public domain, multiple formats

FourmiLab - Complete Archive & Navigation
  URL: https://www.fourmilab.ch/babbage/
  Format: HTML, searchable, indexed

Mathematical Association of America - Notes on Analytic Engine
  URL: https://old.maa.org/press/periodicals/convergence/
       mathematical-treasure-ada-lovelaces-notes-on-the-analytic-engine
  Format: HTML with facsimiles and annotation

Yale TAP Project - Ada Lovelace Notes
  URL: https://www.cs.yale.edu/homes/tap/Files/ada-lovelace-notes.html
  Format: HTML with scholarly notes

Clay Mathematics Institute - Ada's Mathematical Papers
  URL: https://www.claymath.org/online-resources/
       ada-lovelaces-mathematical-papers/
  Format: Curated resource collection

================================================================================
ARCHIVE COLLECTIONS (Primary Sources - Institutional Access)
================================================================================

Science Museum Group Collection
  URL: https://collection.sciencemuseumgroup.org.uk/
  Access: Online search available; digital surrogates for many items
  Key Collections:
    - The Babbage Papers (AA110000003)
    - Drawings of the Analytical Engine (AA110000009)
    - Plan 28 drawings and elevations
    - Difference Engine No. 2 specifications

Bodleian Library, Oxford - Ada Lovelace Archive
  URL: https://archives.bodleian.ox.ac.uk/
  Access: Readers' tickets (free for UK residents with ID; international appointments available)
  Collections:
    - Papers of William and Ada Lovelace (1826-1907)
    - Correspondence with Babbage and De Morgan
    - Mathematical manuscripts

New York Public Library - Pforzheimer Collection
  URL: https://archives.nypl.org/cps/22061
  Access: Appointment system for rare materials
  Contents: 17 items relating to Ada Lovelace

History of Science Museum, Oxford
  URL: https://www.hsm.ox.ac.uk/
  Key Resource: "Imagining AI: Babbage & Lovelace" collection

================================================================================
MODERN RECONSTRUCTION PROJECTS (Online Resources)
================================================================================

Plan 28 Project - Building the Analytical Engine
  Official Blog: https://plan28.org/
  Updates: 2024 progress reports available
  Status: Active development

Plan 28 Blog - 2024 Progress
  URL: http://blog.plan28.org/2024/
  Latest: January 2024 project report

John Graham-Cumming's Blog - Project Launch
  URL: https://blog.jgc.org/2011/09/plan-28-analytical-engine-project-gets.html
  Context: Original project formation (2011)

Computer History Museum - Babbage Engine Exhibition
  URL: https://www.computerhistory.org/babbage/engines/
  Features: Interactive timeline, digital facsimiles, essays

Computer History Museum - Modern Sequel (Duplicate Engines)
  URL: https://www.computerhistory.org/babbage/modernsequel/
  Contents: Documentation of Myhrvold engine (2000), Mountain View display (2008+)

National Museum of Computing - Steam-Powered DE2
  URL: https://www.tnmoc.org/events/2022/11/26/
       well-host-a-working-representation-of-difference-engine-no-2-its-powered-by-a-steam-engine
  Institution: Royal Holloway University of London

================================================================================
USAGE INSTRUCTIONS
================================================================================

1. For Quick Overview:
   - Start with Menabrea (file 05) + Ada's Notes (files 07-10)
   - Read University overviews (files 14-15)

2. For Technical Details:
   - Science Museum technical docs (files 01-03)
   - Bromley analysis (file 04)
   - Doron Swade paper (file 13)

3. For Implementation/Reconstruction:
   - Plan 28 blog (online)
   - Science Museum technical specifications
   - Doron Swade's methodology paper

4. For Philosophical Context:
   - Ada's notes and logic papers (files 08-10)
   - York University analysis (file 16)

5. For Historical Evolution:
   - Montana binary development paper (file 17)
   - Computer History Museum timeline (online)

1. ✓ Create local cache of all publicly available materials
2. ✓ Index all canonical sources with descriptions and access information

4. → For IEEE papers: Access through institutional subscriptions or author requests
5. → For comprehensive research: Combine local cache with online digital collections

Recommended workflow for researchers:
  1. Read SOURCES_INDEX.md for complete overview and collection guide
  2. Review files in priority order based on research focus
  3. Reference online collections for supplementary materials
  4. Contact institutions for primary manuscript access
